title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail: Public Transportation
body: Public Transportation       Public transportation options in many portions of the PHT corridor are extensive, including:   AMTRAK Capitol Limited and Cardinal routes, with stations at Fredericksburg, VA; Alexandria, VA; Washington, D.C.; Harpers Ferry, WV; Cumberland, MD; and Pittsburgh, PA     MARC and VRE regional commuter train services, both with lines to Union Station in DC and MARC with a station at Baltimore Washington International Thurgood Marshall Airport (BWI)     Washington Metropolitan Transit Authority (Metro) trains and buses (including options to transport bicycles on both), with connections to Dulles International Airport (IAD) and Washington National (DCA)     long-distance commercial bus services, leaving near Union Station
